author: Josh Helmuth
title: ‘World Axe Throwing League’ Will Soon Be A Thing
text:
Sports ‘World Axe Throwing League’ Will Soon Be A Thing Bad Axe Throwing, a Canadian club, says they're going global and starting their own amateur world league in the process. by Josh Helmuth Feb 21st, 2017 
In 2017, many gas guzzlers have been replaced with hybrids, phone calls have been replaced with text messages, and darts is now the leisure activity replaced with giant groups of friends wielding axes. 
‘Urban axe throwing’ has exploded across Canada. And now one of the clubs responsible, Bad Axe Throwing , has plans to go worldwide with their own league. 
Bad Axe Throwing is currently in ten cities across Canada and just opened their first U.S. club in Chicago. They plan to open 5-6 more locations throughout the U.S. in 2017, along with other locations overseas, before starting the very first ‘World Axe Throwing League.’ 
According to Mario Zelaya, the league’s chairman, the amateur league will consist of several axe throwing facilities around the world, eventually crowning a world champion that will win prize money. 
“Because of the strong demand for the sport of urban axe throwing, we’re establishing a World Axe Throwing League – similar to what you would expect for the NHL, UFC, NBA, MLB, etc.,” said Zelaya. 
“This global league will the first and only of its kind, led by Bad Axe Throwing but inviting other axe throwing facilities that have been replicating our business model around the world [we’re unifying the sport on a global scale],” he said.

Scores will be accumulated throughout the season and league play of 7 weeks. Playoffs begin on week 8 in which a champion is crowned in a tournament. 
My two cents — just look at the girls in their pictures. No wonder the sport is exploding. 
Josh Helmuth is the editor of Crave Sports.
